title: How the Covid-19 pandemic could reshape restaurants
description: Cafes, restaurants and pubs are reopening to limited customers as states and territories ease social distancing rules. Alyx Gorman examines the challenges the hospitality industry faces as Australia begins to unlock and asks: What will it look like after the pandemic?
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Alyx Gorman. Produced by Ryan Pemberton, Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The exeuctive producers are Gabrielle Jackson and Miles Martignoni

title: Trump versus Biden 2020: the most unpredictable election in history – podcast
description: The US presidential campaign is usually in full swing by this stage of the political cycle, but the coronavirus pandemic has put a halt to rallies and fundraising events. David Smith in Washington looks at how the race between Donald Trump and Joe Biden is playing out
contributors: Presented by Rachel Humphreys and reported by David Smith. Produced by Courtney Yusuf and Axel Kacoutié. Executive producers Phil Maynard and Nicole Jackson. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Ryan Pemberton

title: The sports rorts questions that Scott Morrison still hasn't answered
description: Paul Karp reports on the increased scrutiny the prime minister has faced this week over his office’s involvement in the sports grants scandal
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Paul Karp. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Ryan Pemberton. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: Is India using coronavirus as a pretext to erode civil liberties?
description: South Asia correspondent Hannah Ellis-Petersen reports on the implications of people downloading an app designed to help control the spread of Covid-19 in a country with an increasingly authoritarian government
contributors: Presented by Rachel Humphreys, reported by Hannah Ellis-Petersen and Siddharth Varadarjan. Produced by Joshua Kelly, Courtney Yusuf and Axel Kacoutié. Executive producers Nicole Jackson and Phil Adlem. Additional production by Miles Martignoni and Laura Murphy-Oates.

title: How Bruce Pascoe rebounded from a summer of trauma
description: Last summer the celebrated author Bruce Pascoe found himself in the middle of two life-changing events – the East Gippsland bushfires and a very public controversy surrounding his bestselling book Dark Emu and his Indigenous identity. In this episode, Guardian Australia’s Indigenous affairs editor, Lorena Allam, speaks to Pascoe about how he has rebounded, pouring his efforts into a historic agricultural project in Mallacoota  ‘Time to embrace history of country’: Bruce Pascoe and the first dancing grass harvest in 200 years
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Lorena Allam and Isabella Moore. Produced by Joe Koning and Ellen Leabeater. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: How the coronavirus is affecting women’s work in Australia
description: When it comes to unpaid housework and caring duties, Australian women are among the most overworked in the world. They’re also overrepresented in low-paid jobs on the frontline of Covid-19 – such as aged care, childcare and disability support work.In this episode of the Full Story podcast, producer Ellen Leabeater explores how the pandemic is making gender inequality more visible, and also, a lot worse
contributors: Presented by Gabrielle Jackson.  Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Miles Martignoni. The executive producers are Gabrielle Jackson and Miles Martignoni.

title: Reopening America's poorest state
description: Despite rising coronavirus case numbers, the US state of Mississippi is moving out of lockdown and reopening parks, restaurants and other non-essential shops. Oliver Laughland went to the resort of Biloxi to see how residents were responding
contributors: Presented by Mythili Rao and reported by Oliver Laughland. Produced by Mythili Rao and Axel Kacoutié. Executive producers Phil Maynard and Nicole Jackson. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Miles Martignoni

title: What George Pell knew
description: After a five-year inquiry, the royal commission into institutional responses to child sexual abuse handed down its final report in late 2017. But due to legal action, the findings about Cardinal George Pell were redacted. Now the whole report has been released, Melissa Davey explains what the inquiry found about Pell’s knowledge of child abuse in the church
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Melissa Davey. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: The two Angus Taylor scandals that won't go away
description: In the past year Australia’s energy minister has been swept up in two scandals. The past week has brought developments in both. Anne Davies explains what questions he has yet to answer
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Anne Davies. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: The race for face masks happening around the world
description: When the coronavirus began spreading beyond China in January, the race to buy up any available protective face masks went global. In this episode we look at the frenzy of buying and how the race to obtain enough masks shows no sign of slowing down
contributors: Presented by Rachel Humphreys and reported by Samanth Subramanian. Produced by Serena Barker-Singh and Axel Kacoutié. Executive producers Phil Maynard and Nicole Jackson. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Joe Koning

title: The people left behind in Australia's coronavirus response
description: Scott Morrison has said of the pandemic, ‘we’re all in this together’ but his government has excluded more than 1 million people from assistance. Laura Murphy-Oates talks to some of those people and Ben Doherty analyses the government’s response.
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Ben Doherty. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and  Gabrielle Jackson

title: Surviving the coronavirus: how one man's time in the ICU changed his life
description: ‘The thing that surprised me was how quickly I went from being able to breathe to not being able to breathe.’ Sixty-year-old helicopter pilot Dave Lewins tells what it’s like to live through Covid-19
contributors: Presented by Anushka Asthana, produced by Hannah Moore. The executive producers are Nicole Jackson and Phil Maynard. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Joe Koning

title: Is remdesivir an effective treatment for Covid-19?
description: An experimental treatment for coronavirus called remdesivir, which will be trialled in Australia, was hailed as a breakthrough for Covid-19 treatment last week. But some experts urge caution and say serious questions remain to be answered
contributors: Presented by Laura Murphy-Oates and reported by Melissa Davey. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Ryan Pemberton. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: How the coronavirus has changed Australia's healthcare system
description: Gabrielle Jackson talks to Dr Richard Nguyen and Dr Ranjana Srivastava about the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on healthcare in this country, and which changes are here to stay
contributors: Presented by Gabrielle Jackson. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The executive producer is Miles Martignoni

title: The Mudgee corner store and the jobkeeper program
description: Paul Karp explores the kinks in the government’s $130bn jobkeeper program, and Laura Murphy-Oates speaks to one small business owner whose life has been turned upside down by the coronavirus
contributors: Reported by Paul Karp and presented by Laura Murphy-Oates. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni  and  Gabrielle Jackson.

title: How coronavirus spread through South America
description: From his accommodation in Rio de Janeiro, the Guardian’s Latin America correspondent, Tom Phillips, can hear the nightly protests against Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro’s handling of the Covid-19 pandemic, where cases are steadily rising. He discusses how Brazil and other South American countries are trying to deal with the pandemic
contributors: Presented by Anushka Asthana with Tom Phillips, produced by Rose de Larrabeiti and Iain Chambers; executive producers are Nicole Jackson and Phil Maynard. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Joe Koning

title: The latest on the Covidsafe app
description: Josh Taylor examines the Covidsafe app released on Sunday and updates us on whether the government has addressed the community concern over privacy
contributors: Reported by Josh Taylor and hosted by Laura Murphy-Oates. Produced by Ellen Leabeater and Joe Koning. The executive producers are Miles Martignoni and Gabrielle Jackson

title: How has the coronavirus transformed Spain?
description: Luis Encinas is a nurse and Médecins Sans Frontières coordinator. He has treated patients in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, in Sierra Leone as Ebola took hold, and now in Spain, battling Covid-19. He and the Guardian’s Madrid correspondent, Sam Jones, describe how the virus has transformed Spain
contributors: Presented by Anushka Asthana and reported by Sam Jones. Produced by Mythili Rao. The executive producers are Nicole Jackson and Phil Maynard. Adapted by Laura Murphy-Oates and Joe Koning.

title: Virgin Australia’s woes and the future of Australian air travel
description: Will Virgin Australia will survive? And what it means for the future of air travel if it doesn’t.
contributors: Reported by Ben Butler and presented by Laura Murphy-Oates. Produced by Joe Koning and Ellen Leabeater. The executive producers are Gabrielle Jackson and Miles Martignoni.

title: Under attack: WHO and the coronavirus pandemic
description: The World Health Organization has been at the forefront of the global response to new diseases. It was hailed for the way it dealt with Sars but pilloried for its handling of Ebola. Now, just as we may need it the most, Donald Trump is threatening to withdraw US funding. So how effective has the WHO been during the coronavirus pandemic?
contributors: Presented by Anushka Asthana with Stephen Buranyi produced by Cheeka Eyers ,  Joe Koningand Nicholas Cox; executive producers Phil Maynard and Nicole Jackson.
